job_title: IT Support Specialist in Bangor, MI
pros: Lovely people, great benefits, and decent pay for the area
cons: Located out in the sticks, so commuting there can be a hassle

job_title: Payroll Benefits Specialist in Bangor, MI
pros: Weekends off. That’s the only pro.
cons: -little to no training at all, on anything -unprofessional and poor, uneducated, brand new leadership -lack of interpersonal skills and compassion -lack of confidentiality -everyone is new and no one knows what they are doing -discrimination (don’t ask to talk about a problem, you’ll get canned for a bogus reason) -favoritism played. What one can do, the other can’t. -no checks and balances. No one checks anyone’s work, there’s no checks and balances, super scary. -awful, terrible, outdated systems that only occasionally work -no SOP’s….50 years with no SOP’s -if you’re salary, expect to work over 50 hours per week and if you need to go to an appointment you can’t flex that time, you’d have to use paid time off even though you’ve worked over your hours…they don’t understand how salary works -don’t waste your time, look elsewhere

review_title: This a company with set and achievable goals
pros: Nice place to work, great atmosphere, nice co-workers, laxed environment
cons: Most employees are not up to date with current initiatives of company. Delays with information exchange between managers and individuals they supervise does not travel.

job_title: Dental Assistant in Benton Harbor, MI
pros: Fun place to work. Good pay
cons: Patients can be hard to deal with .4 day work week

pros: Pay was ok, hours were good for me. Most of the doctors, nurses, and staff were kind and helpful.
cons: Some of the staff would talk poorly about the patients behind their backs. Some patients were hard to help. It’s located in a very poor area with lots of people struggling with addiction.

job_title: Certified Medical Assistant (CMA) in Benton Harbor, MI
pros: Good pay best in the city
cons: Heavy work load too much work on ma

review_title: Great Mission! But lacks solid business model
pros:
Holland Clinic sees a vast variety of patients without regard to socioeconomic status. 
The nurses, and other staff are usually bilingual.
Nurses are dedicated to quality patient outcomes.
Behavioral health support
cons:
Older facility that needs maintenance 
Administration is not transparent.
Very limited provider input in decision  making and policy development.
EHR is NextGen.
Company has been losing money for 2 years and is cutting support staff.

pros: Most of the folks at the clinical sites are nice, some health insurance and dental coverage
cons: Very political environment at the Admin site, if you don't kiss up to the right people you won't last long. Upper management is only worried about themselves, everyone else they don't care about. Had high hopes when I started, by the end before I left I lost all motivation to work, no respect for my boss who says one thing then does another, used to go above and beyond what was expected of me but that was never recognized and even criticized so I stopped bothering. The procedures they outline for certain departments to follow are never enforced. Mid-level management is willing to throw those who work for them under the proverbial bus if it makes them look better to upper management.

pros: Able to work independently and use my nursing skills. Patients are very appreciative and it gives me great safisfaction helping the less fortunate.
cons: My skills, leadership and past accomplishments are not acknowledged by Intercare nor are they compensated for financially....Pay scale is not even close to what the nurses in this geographical location are are making. ..........Also, this is a seasonal position.

review_title: Lacks Leadership, Stability, Consistency & No Loyalty To Employee's.
job_title: Registered Dental Hygienist in Benton Harbor, MI
pros: There is not a shortage of a patient base. Benefits are average. This organization would be a okay or average fit for an employee who is unseasoned or new in their profession.
cons: Low starting pay, minimal pay increases every two-three years, top heavy in the administration department.  Poor management.

pros: Serve the underserved community. Can utilize various skills and training.
cons: staff are catty and clickish. Instead of working together its everyone for themselves.

pros: Casual work environment with flexible work schedules.
cons: Not as employee oriented as they claim to be.

pros: Not much to say here. Like any other workplace.
cons: They are operating severely in the red.

job_title: RN Care Manager in Pullman, MI
pros: Patients were great and Pullman staff very supportive. Culturally diverse.
cons: Management was terrible and provided little support. InterCare fosters  and enables bullying work environment.
